content:
To achieve the desired output, you need to adjust the way you're reading the CSV file and set the headers properly. Since the first row of your data appears to be the headers, you should specify that the first row is not a header. Instead, you can manually assign the headers after reading the data. Here's how you can do it:

```python
import pandas as pd

# Read the CSV file without headers
user1 = pd.read_csv('dataset/1.csv', header=None)

# Assign the column names
user1.columns = ['TIME', 'X', 'Y', 'Z']

# Print the dataframe
print(user1)
```

This code will read the CSV file as if it doesn't have any headers, and then it manually assigns the column names `['TIME', 'X', 'Y', 'Z']` to the DataFrame, resulting in the desired output format.
